comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Investing in cryptos is much easier than starting a business. For a business, you need:- a business plan (what's it going to be? where and how?);- initial investment;- licensing, contracts, most likely employees;- keeping track of your spendings and profits, hoping that after a few years you start getting to a zero balance and then profit.For crypto investment, you need to download Electrum and write down your passphrase to a safe place, go on an exchange and purchase Bitcoin with the money you're willing to dedicate to it, withdraw Bitcoin into your Electrum wallet, hodl. Maybe you'll need to pay taxes, but that depends on a country and it's up to you. You hodl and wait for Bitcoin to reach your target price. With business, you also need to run it, so you're investing a lot of your own time into it.I think that realizing that investing requires a way lower effort might inspire more people to do it.
